alert.note: Alert for Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 14 at 5:43PM MST until February 16 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER STORM TO BRING HEAVY SNOW TO PORTIONS OF THE MOUNTAINS AND PLAINS... .A winter storm will bring snow, heavy at times, to most areas roughly along and south of I-70 through Wednesday evening. The heaviest snow is expected in the mountains surrounding Park County, the southern foothills, the Palmer Divide (including I-25 between Denver and Colorado Springs), and possibly portions of I-70 through the plains. Snow will be heaviest tonight into Wednesday morning, with lighter snow lingering much of the day on Wednesday. In addition, gusty winds will lead to localized blowing snow concerns. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT MST WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Akron. * WHEN...From Midnight tonight to Midnight MST Wednesday Night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
